shell

Class Shell

  • java.lang.Object
    • shell.Shell

  • public class Shell
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for the Hangman game's shell.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  Shell.PhaseNumberOutOfBoundsException
      Thrown to indicate that a wrong phase has been specified for the getHangman(int) method.

      Shell()
      Creates a new Shell instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shell

        public Shell()
        Creates a new Shell instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getHangman

        protected final java.lang.String getHangman(int phase)
                                     throws Shell.PhaseNumberOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the string representation of the game state considering the missed characters.
        Parameters:
        phase - The number of the missed characters.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the game state.
        Throws:
        Shell.PhaseNumberOutOfBoundsException - The thrown exception if the phase is out of the 0-5 range.

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initializes the shell's fields before the execution of the first command.

        In the subclass of the Shell class, this is a good place to write code here that you want to execute before the execution of the first command; for example, to print your own fields' initial values.

        It is recommended to call the superclass' init() method before your any calculations.

      • readEvalPrint

        public final void readEvalPrint()
        Reads, evaluates the commands specified in the shell, and prints their results to the console.

        If the shell has not any command that finishes the running of the shell, please use the end-of-file (EOF) character to do it.

      • addCommand

        public final void addCommand(Command c)
        Adds a new command to the shell's commands.
        Parameters:
        c - The command to be added.

      • format

        public final void format(java.lang.String format,
          java.lang.Object... args)
        Writes a formatted string to this object's destination using the specified format string and arguments.
        Parameters:
        format - A format string as described in Format string syntax.
        args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by The Java™ Virtual Machine Specification.

      • nextLine

        public final java.lang.String nextLine()
        Advances this scanner past the current line and returns the input that was skipped. This method returns the rest of the current line, excluding any line separator at the end. The position is set to the beginning of the next line.

        Since this method continues to search through the input looking for a line separator, it may buffer all of the input searching for the line to skip if no line separators are present.

        Returns:
        The line that was skipped.

      • exit

        public final void exit(int status)
        Terminates the currently running Java Virtual Machine. The argument serves as a status code; by convention, a nonzero status code indicates abnormal termination.

        This method calls the exit method in class System. This method never returns normally.

        Parameters:
        status - Exit status.
        See Also:
        System.exit(int)
